alert.note: Alert for Arkansas; Grant; Jefferson; Lonoke; Monroe; Prairie; Pulaski; Woodruff (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued April 13 at 3:47PM CDT until April 13 at 6:50PM CDT by NWS Little Rock
info.description: The National Weather Service in Little Rock has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Southeastern Grant County in central Arkansas... Lonoke County in central Arkansas... Prairie County in central Arkansas... Southeastern Pulaski County in central Arkansas... Monroe County in eastern Arkansas... Woodruff County in eastern Arkansas... Northwestern Arkansas County in southeastern Arkansas... Western Jefferson County in southeastern Arkansas... * Until 650 PM CDT. * At 347 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated showers and thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 1 to 2 inches of rain have occurred, with locally heavier amounts. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Little Rock, North Little Rock, Pine Bluff, Stuttgart, Lonoke, Brinkley, Des Arc, Clarendon, Hazen, De Valls Bluff, White Hall, England, Carlisle, Wrightsville, Redfield, Holly Grove, Humphrey, Patterson, Fredonia and Humnoke. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.

area.areaDesc: Arkansas; Grant; Jefferson; Lonoke; Monroe; Prairie; Pulaski; Woodruff
